faq.q: How do I export Chase transactions to CSV?
faq.a: Log in to Chase online banking, go to Statements & Activity, select your account and date range, then click Download and choose CSV format.

faq.q: Can I export Chase credit card transactions?
faq.a: Yes, both checking and credit card transactions can be exported using the same process in the Activity section.

faq.q: What date range can I export from Chase?
faq.a: Chase typically allows exports for up to 18-24 months of transaction history.

faq.q: Does Chase support OFX format?
faq.a: Yes, Chase supports CSV, OFX, and QFX formats for transaction exports.

steps.title: Log in to Chase online banking
steps.body: Visit chase.com and sign in with your username and password.

steps.title: Navigate to Statements & Activity
steps.body: Select the account you want to export from the account list.

steps.title: Select date range
steps.body: Choose the date range for transactions you want to export (up to 18 months).

steps.title: Download transactions
steps.body: Click the Download button and select CSV format from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Save and categorize
steps.body: Save the CSV file to your computer, then upload it to our free categorizer tool.

quirks: Chase may limit downloads to 500 transactions per export
Business accounts have a separate portal at chase.com/business

faq.q: How do I download Bank of America transactions?
faq.a: Sign in to Online Banking, select your account, go to Statements & Documents, then choose Download Transactions and select CSV format.

faq.q: Can I export business account transactions?
faq.a: Yes, Bank of America business accounts support CSV exports through the Business Advantage portal.

faq.q: How far back can I download transactions?
faq.a: Bank of America allows downloads for up to 24 months of transaction history.

faq.q: What file formats does BofA support?
faq.a: Bank of America supports CSV, QFX, OFX, and QBO formats.

steps.title: Sign in to Online Banking
steps.body: Go to bankofamerica.com and log in with your credentials.

steps.title: Select your account
steps.body: Choose the checking, savings, or credit card account from your account list.

steps.title: Access download options
steps.body: Click on Statements & Documents, then select Download Transactions.

steps.title: Choose format and date range
steps.body: Select CSV format and specify your desired date range (up to 24 months).

steps.title: Download and process
steps.body: Click Download, save the file, and upload to the categorizer tool.

quirks: May require enabling downloads in security settings

faq.q: How do I export Wells Fargo transactions?
faq.a: Log in to Wells Fargo Online, select your account, click Download Account Activity, choose CSV format and your date range.

faq.q: Can I export Wells Fargo credit card transactions?
faq.a: Yes, credit card transactions can be exported the same way as checking account transactions.

faq.q: What is the maximum export period?
faq.a: Wells Fargo allows exports for up to 18 months of transaction data.

faq.q: Does Wells Fargo support Quicken format?
faq.a: Yes, Wells Fargo supports QFX (Quicken) and OFX formats in addition to CSV.

steps.title: Log in to Wells Fargo Online
steps.body: Visit wellsfargo.com and sign in with your username and password.

steps.title: Select account
steps.body: Choose the account you want to export from your account summary.

steps.title: Access download options
steps.body: Click on Download Account Activity in the account details section.

steps.title: Select format and dates
steps.body: Choose CSV format and select your date range (up to 18 months).

steps.title: Download and categorize
steps.body: Download the file and upload it to our categorizer for instant categorization.

quirks: Business accounts may have different download limits
May need to disable pop-up blockers

faq.q: How do I download Citi bank transactions?
faq.a: Sign in to Citi Online, select your account, go to Account Activity, then click Download and choose CSV format.

faq.q: Can I export Citi credit card statements?
faq.a: Yes, both bank and credit card transactions can be exported to CSV format.

faq.q: How many months of transactions can I export?
faq.a: Citi allows exports for up to 18 months of transaction history.

faq.q: What formats does Citi support?
faq.a: Citi supports CSV, OFX, QFX, and QBO formats for various accounting software.

steps.title: Sign in to Citi Online
steps.body: Go to citibank.com or citi.com and log in to your account.

steps.title: Navigate to Account Activity
steps.body: Select the account you want to export and click on Account Activity.

steps.title: Choose download option
steps.body: Click the Download link at the top of your transaction list.

steps.title: Select CSV format
steps.body: Choose CSV from the format dropdown and select your date range.

steps.title: Process your export
steps.body: Download the file and use our free categorizer to organize your transactions.

faq.q: How do I export Capital One transactions?
faq.a: Log in to your Capital One account, select your card or account, go to View All Transactions, then click Download.

faq.q: Can I export Capital One credit card transactions?
faq.a: Yes, Capital One makes it easy to export both credit card and bank account transactions.

faq.q: What date range can I download?
faq.a: Capital One typically allows downloads for up to 12-18 months.

faq.q: Does Capital One support OFX format?
faq.a: Yes, Capital One supports CSV, OFX, and QFX formats.

steps.title: Log in to Capital One
steps.body: Visit capitalone.com and sign in with your credentials.

steps.title: Select your account
steps.body: Choose the credit card or bank account you want to export.

steps.title: View all transactions
steps.body: Click on View All Transactions to see your complete transaction history.

steps.title: Download transactions
steps.body: Click the Download button and select CSV as your format.

steps.title: Categorize instantly
steps.body: Upload your CSV to our free categorizer for automatic categorization.

faq.q: What file formats are available?
faq.a: U.S. Bank supports CSV, OFX, and QFX formats.

faq.q: How many transactions can I export at once?

faq.q: Does PayPal support QuickBooks format?

faq.a: Independence allows exports for up to 18 months.

faq.q: What formats are supported?
faq.a: Independence supports CSV, OFX, and QFX.

steps.title: Sign in
steps.body: Log in to your bank's online portal.

faq.q: How do I export Pinnacle transactions?
faq.a: Log in to Pinnacle Online Banking, select your account, click Export, and choose CSV.

faq.a: Pinnacle allows exports for up to 18 months.

faq.q: What happened to BBVA USA?
faq.a: BBVA USA was acquired by PNC Bank in 2021. Accounts have been migrated to PNC.

faq.q: Can I still access BBVA transactions?
faq.a: Former BBVA customers should now use PNC's online banking to access transaction history.

faq.q: How do I export old BBVA data?
faq.a: Log in to PNC online banking with your migrated credentials to access and export historical transactions.

faq.q: Where should I go for banking now?
faq.a: Visit pnc.com to access your account (formerly BBVA USA).

steps.title: Note
steps.body: BBVA USA was acquired by PNC Bank. Please visit pnc.com for account access.

steps.title: Log in to PNC
steps.body: Use your migrated credentials at pnc.com.

steps.title: Access history
steps.body: Your BBVA transaction history is available in PNC.

steps.title: Export
steps.body: Follow PNC's export process for CSV downloads.

quirks: Acquired by PNC in 2021 - marked noindex

faq.q: What happened to People's United Bank?
faq.a: People's United Bank merged with M&T Bank in 2022. Accounts have been migrated.

faq.q: Can I still export People's United transactions?
faq.a: Former customers should use M&T Bank's online banking to access and export transactions.

faq.q: How do I access my old account?
faq.a: Log in to M&T Bank with your migrated credentials at mtb.com.

faq.q: Where should I go now?
faq.a: Visit mtb.com to access your account (formerly People's United).

faq.q: What happened to Signature Bank?
faq.a: Signature Bank was closed by regulators in March 2023. Deposits were transferred to Flagstar Bank (now New York Community Bank).

faq.q: How do I access my Signature Bank data?
faq.a: Former Signature customers should contact New York Community Bank / Flagstar for account access and historical data.

faq.q: Can I still export transactions?
faq.a: Contact New York Community Bank at mynycb.com for assistance with historical transaction data.

faq.q: Where should I go for help?
faq.a: Visit mynycb.com or flagstar.com for account assistance.

steps.title: Note
steps.body: Signature Bank was closed in 2023. Deposits transferred to Flagstar/NYCB.

steps.title: Contact NYCB
steps.body: Visit mynycb.com or call for account assistance.

steps.title: Request data
steps.body: Ask for historical transaction export assistance.

faq.q: What happened to PacWest Bank?
faq.a: PacWest Bank merged with Banc of California in 2023 to form a new institution.

faq.q: How do I access my PacWest transactions?
faq.a: Former PacWest customers should use the new merged bank's online banking for transaction history.

faq.q: Can I still export my data?
faq.a: Contact the merged institution for assistance with exporting historical transaction data.

faq.q: Where should I go now?
faq.a: Visit bancofcal.com for information about the merged bank.
